channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Street light damaged, 9th September
item.description:
Due to the banner on the street light , during high winds street light has been swaying and cause damage to the light column and the light column is now leaning over
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Blackfriars Road, Southwark, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Street Light - Equipment damaged, pole leaning

item.title: Bags with rubbish dumped across the block, 9th September
item.description:
I am writing to report an ongoing and serious issue with rubbish dumping and poor maintenance in and around Broadway House. For over a month, there have been multiple bags of rubbish and furniture dumped across the area
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Jackman Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Post /mail boxes are broken, 9th September

item.title: The light outside bin room is not working., 9th September
item.description:
The light outside main bin room is not working.I tried to exchange the light bulb,but it's still broken.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thamesmead, London

item.title: Fly tipping and overfilling of bins, 9th September
item.description:
Continuous fly tipping daily on Richardson Close. With bins getting so full most residents can’t even put their household waste into. This has been going on for at least 2 years. The bins need to be more secure with access to residents only.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stean Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upton Road, Blendon, London

item.title: Dumped mattress etc, 9th September
item.description:
Someone has dumped a mattress and tent(?) on the wall of my house. Assume this was done during the night of 8th September.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1b, Vanbrugh Park Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside house Capo di Monte, Windmill Hill NW3 6RJ, 9th September
item.description:
I reported 8 July, Fixmystreet ref: 7828483. You incorrectly recorded address "outside judges walk house". "Residents are planting bushes blocking the footpath ... and state that they have an agreement with camden to do this." On 2 Sep Camden emailed me "investigated and fixed". Nothing has changed and the footpath is still impassable with bushes growing. Please explain what you have fixed, or tell me if there is such an agreement. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Judges' Walk, West Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree still nothing been done it’s lifting roots into my garden and still waiting for approval to be able to be cut been going on 4years, 9th September
item.description:
Hi so I’ve been told so many different stories regarding this tree saying it’s protected and been going on last 4years I’ve heard the same thing regarding this a tree down the road has been completely taken away and this tree is getting left it’s causing people to still dump rubbish behind the pushes at the bottom of tree I’ve had 2 rats on my front garden and I have children and keep getting told you need permission so do I keep waiting another 4years before anything is done regarding this as I’m about to contact local mp regarding this because this has been going on far to long and never been trimmed in whole 4/5 years I’ve been here if not longer. It’s too big for me to trim myself as it over towers the house and is affecting my side garden for my children’s play area as roots are lifting in there also I want a date this is going to be done rather than keep getting told different stories

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Keedonwood Road, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Floodlight on Lamp post illuminating west facing clock has failed, 9th September
